1.control-description: This parameter is used to specify the combination of board build and firmware.

2.control-description: This parameter indicates the date and time the firmware was built.

3.control-description: This parameter indicates the firmware major revision number. For example, if the firmware version is 1.02.03 build 72, the major revision number is 1.

4.control-description: This parameter indicates the firmware minor revision number. For example, if the firmware version is 1.02.03 build 72, the minor revision number is 2.

6.control-description: This parameter indicates the firmware build number.  For example, if the firmware version is 1.02.03 build 72, the build number is 72.

8.control-description: This is a unique identifier used to identify the board. All boards, regardless of whether they support the same product(s), have this unique identifier.

9.control-description: Name of the board where the firmware resides.  Note, that a board can support many products.

10.control-description: This parameter indicates the revision of the board where the firmware resides.  The board revision increases are usually a result of enhancements or fixes to the current board revision.  It is typically represented by a letter, for example 'C'.

11.control-description: The firmware may support multiple board stuff options. If this is the case, and the stuff option cannot be detected by the firmware, the build number is used to represent the stuff option.  For example, if an I2C device is optionally stuff, firmware can detect the presence of the device, and a new hardware build number is not needed. But, if for example, the values of some resistors and capacitors are changed, and the firmware needs to be aware of this, a new hardware build number is needed.

13.control-description: This parameter sets the physical interface to streaming out log.

14.control-description: This parameter is used to diable or enable log streaming.

15.control-description: This parameter sets the destination IP address.

16.control-description: This parameter sets the UDP port number.

17.control-description: This parameter sets the level to streaming log.

20.control-description: This parameter sets the Operation ID, which will be in the sysLog.

50.control-description: This parameter allows user  to reboot the system.

51.control-description: This parameter allows user to do factory reset.

54.control-description: This parameter returns product Serial Number.

55.control-description: This parameter allows user to set alias name for this product.

57.control-description: This parameter allows user to export system log to file.

58.control-description: This parameter returns current FPGA name.

59.control-description: This parameter allows user to select FPGA.

93.control-description: This parameter allows user to Import preset from file.

94.control-description: This parameter allows user to export preset to file.

100.control-description: This parameter allows user to set IP address for control port.

101.control-description: This parameter allows user to set IP netmask for control port.

102.control-description: This parameter allows user to set IP gateway for control port.

103.control-description: This parameter allows user to restart control port, used to apply control port settings.

110.control-description: This parameter returns power supply status.

111.control-description: This parameter returns FPGA temperature (not used for now).

113.control-description: This parameter allows user to set FPGA temperature alarm threshold.

115.control-description: This parameter returns fan status. This parameter is subject to product options.

116.control-description: This parameter allows user to set fan speed. This parameter is subject to product options.

117.control-description: This parameter retruns fan speed status in rpm. This parameter is subject to product options.

120.control-description: This parameter allows user to select different time source.

121.control-description: This parameter allows user to get and set the value of the real time clock. The format for setting the clock is mm/dd/yy hh:mm, the clock will not  set properly if this format is not followed.

122.control-description: This parameter allows user to select different time zone.

123.control-description: This parameter allows user to select Day Light Saving ON or OFF.

124.control-description: This parameter allows user to select external NTP server.

125.control-description: This parameter allows user to restart time management to apply changes.

160.control-description: This parameter returns genlock input status of the frame.

161.control-description: This parameter returns genlock input locked status.

162.control-description: This parameter returns genlock input standard.

163.control-description: This parameter returns current VITC time (and drop-frame flag).

164.control-description: This parameter allows user to select the reference source(s) for frame distribution.

165.control-description: This parameter allows user to select the source of the video sync signal to distribute to the modules.

166.control-description: This parameter allows user to choose the video standard for the generated sync.

200.control-description: This parameter allows user to select a macro file. (Dynamic-ComboBox)

201.control-description: This parameter allows user to input argument for macro execution.

202.control-description: This parameter allows user to input argument for macro execution.

203.control-description: This parameter allows user to input argument for macro execution.

204.control-description: This parameter allows user to input argument for macro execution.

205.control-description: This parameter allows user to input argument for macro execution.

206.control-description: This parameter allows user to execute a macro file selected.

207.control-description: This parameter allows user to upload macro file.

208.control-description: This parameter displays the macro file name.

209.control-description: This parameter displays the macro file descriptions.

211.control-description: This parameter allows user to remove the macro file.

212.control-description: This parameter allows user to input name for macro uploaded.

213.control-description: This parameter allows user to input description for macro uploaded.

900.control-description: Control to download certificate sign request (CSR).

901.control-description: Control to upload the signed certificate.

902.control-description: Control to upload the CA certificate.

1000.control-description: This parameter returns SFP present status.

1003.control-description: This parameter returns SFP serial number.

1004.control-description: This parameter returns SFP firmware versionr.

1005.control-description: This parameter returns SFP laser wavelength, only available if SFP connector type is fibe.

1007.control-description: This parameter returns SFP supply voltage.

1008.control-description: This parameter returns SFP channel direction.

1009.control-description: This parameter returns SFP channel receive optical power, only available if SFP connector is fiber.

1010.control-description: This parameter allows user to set SFP channel receive power threshold for alarm, only available if SFP connector is fiber.

1011.control-description: This parameter returns SFP channel optical input signal present status, only available if SFP connector is fiber.

1012.control-description: This parameter returns SFP channel video signal present status, only available if SFP connector is DIN.

1013.control-description: This parameter returns SFP channel video signal rate, only available if SFP connector is DIN.

2000.control-description: This parameter returns the MIO module present status.

2001.control-description: This parameter returns the MIO module name.

2002.control-description: This parameter returns the MIO module serial number.

2003.control-description: This parameter returns the MIO module firmware version.

2004.control-description: This parameter returns the MIO module temperature in degrees.

2005.control-description: This parameter allows user to reset the MIO module.

2006.control-description: This parameter allows user to export the MIO module configuration.

2007.control-description: This parameter allows user to Import the MIO module configuration.

2008.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the MIO module IP address for control port network if control port is available.

2009.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the MIO module IP netmask for control port network if control port is available.

2010.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the MIO module IP gateway for control port network if control port is available.

3000.control-description: This parameter returns the name of the top level crosspoint input.

3001.control-description: This parameter returns the availability of the top level crosspoint input.

3002.control-description: This parameter returns the type of the top level crosspoint input.

3003.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the name tag for the top level crosspoint input.

3004.control-description: This parameter returns the name of the top level crosspoint output.

3005.control-description: This parameter returns the availablility of the top level crosspoint output.

3006.control-description: This parameter returns the type of the top level crosspoint output.

3007.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the routing mode for the top level crosspoint output. (Change the mode will disconnect current route on this output).

3008.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the name tag for the top level crosspoint output.

3009.control-description: This parameter allows user to set the route for the top level crosspoint. 0 means disconnect.

3010.control-description: This parameter returns the route state of the top level crosspoint,.

3011.control-description: This parameter allows user to set to force the signal type for the top level crosspoint input.

3012.control-description: This parameter allows user to set to force the signal type for the top level crosspoint output.

3013.control-description: This parameter returns the signal type of the top level crosspoint input.

3014.control-description: This parameter returns the signal type of the top level crosspoint output.
